tags.name: cds-accordion-content
tags.description:
Web component accordion content to be used inside an accordion

```typescript
import '@cds/core/accordion/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-accordion>
   <cds-accordion-panel expanded>
     <cds-accordion-header>Item 1</cds-accordion-header>
     <cds-accordion-content>Content 1</cds-accordion-content>
   </cds-accordion-panel>
   <cds-accordion-panel>
     <cds-accordion-header>Item 2</cds-accordion-header>
     <cds-accordion-content>Content 2</cds-accordion-content>
   </cds-accordion-panel>
   <cds-accordion-panel disabled>
     <cds-accordion-header>Item 3</cds-accordion-header>
     <cds-accordion-content>Content 3</cds-accordion-content>
   </cds-accordion-panel>
</cds-accordion>
```

tags.name: cds-alert-actions
tags.description:
Web component alert actions to be used inside default and banner alerts.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/alert/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-alert>
   Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
   <cds-alert-actions>
     <cds-button>Fix</cds-button>
   </cds-alert-actions>
</cds-alert>
```

tags.name: cds-alert-group
tags.description:
Alert groups are containers for a set of alerts. Alert groups can hold one or many alerts
inside of them with the expectation that all alerts will be of the same type. The exception
to this rule is the `loading` alert type, which will be displayed regardless of the type
of alert group containing it.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/alert/register.js';
```

```html
   <cds-alert-group type="danger">
     <cds-alert closable="true">
       Single alert
       <cds-alert-actions>
         buttons, links
       </cds-alert-actions>
     </cds-alert>
     <cds-alert type="loading">
       Single Alert
     </cds-alert>
     <cds-alert closable="true">
       Another alert
       <cds-alert-actions>
         buttons, links
       </cds-alert-actions>
     </cds-alert>
   </cds-alert-group>
```

properties.name: size
properties.description: Sets the overall height and width of the alerts inside the alert group

properties.name: type
properties.description: Passed down into the alerts inside the alert-group

properties.name: role
properties.description: Autosets the alert groups aria role to 'region'

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the status of the alerts inside the alert group
properties.type: neutral | info | success | warning | danger | alt | loading

slots.description: Content slot for the alerts

tags.name: cds-alert
tags.description:
Alerts are banners that communicate a message with a severity attached to it.
They grab the user’s attention to provide critical information needed in context.

Alerts outside of a cds-alert-group or cds-app-alert-group component will be
displayed as a "lightweight alert". Lightweight alerts, by default, provide no
close button component and they inherit no status (a.k.a. success, danger, etc.).

Alerts inside a cds-alert-group component inherit their status from the containing
alert group.

Alerts inside a cds-app-alert-group component inherit their status as a default from
the containing app-alert group, although it can be overridden on individual alerts.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/alert/register.js';
```

```html
   <cds-alert>
     Single Alert
     <cds-alert-actions>
       buttons, links
     </cds-alert-actions>
   </cds-alert>
```

properties.name: size
properties.description: Sets the overall height and width of the alert and icon based on value

properties.name: closable
properties.description:
If false, the alert will not render the close button.

Lightweight alerts do not display close buttons

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the color of the alert from a predefined list of statuses
properties.type: neutral | info | success | warning | danger | alt | loading

properties.name: i18n
properties.type: { closeButtonAriaLabel: string; loading: string; info: string; success: string; warning: string; danger: string; }

events.name: closeChange
events.description: notify when the user has clicked the dismiss button

slots.description: Content slot for inside the alert

tags.name: cds-button
tags.description:
Buttons allow an application to communicate action and direct user intent.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/button/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-button>submit</cds-button>
```

properties.name: action
properties.description:
Define the type of action the button triggers

- `solid`: buttons direct the user’s attention to the primary action the application is suggesting that the user take.
- `outline`: buttons indicate secondary actions that compliments a primary action or reduces visual noise when there are many actions on the page.
- `flat`: buttons are used as tertiary buttons. Can also be used inline because they are different from content in style and recognizable as buttons alongside content.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the color of the button to match the following string statuses

properties.name: size
properties.description: Sets the overall height and width of the button based on the following string values:

properties.name: block
properties.description: Sets if the button should be full width with display block

properties.name: loadingState
properties.description: Changes the button content based on the value passed.

slots.description: Content slot for inside the button

tags.name: cds-icon-button
tags.description:
Icon buttons give applications a compact alternative to communicate action and direct user intent.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/button/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-icon-button><cds-icon shape="download"></cds-icon></cds-icon-button>
```

properties.name: ariaLabel
properties.description:
The aria-label attribute is required for accessibility. The cds-icon-button
will warn if used without the aria-label being set.

Ideally, the aria-label will be specific to the button's purpose. Avoid sharing
generic labels across multiple icon buttons on a page.

properties.name: action
properties.description:
Define the type of action the button triggers

- `solid`: buttons direct the user’s attention to the primary action the application is suggesting that the user take.
- `outline`: buttons indicate secondary actions that compliments a primary action or reduces visual noise when there are many actions on the page.
- `flat`: buttons are used as tertiary buttons. Can also be used inline because they are different from content in style and recognizable as buttons alongside content.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the color of the button to match the following string statuses

properties.name: size
properties.description: Sets the overall height and width of the button based on the following string values:

properties.name: block
properties.description: Sets if the button should be full width with display block

properties.name: loadingState
properties.description: Changes the button content based on the value passed.

slots.description: Content slot for inside the button

tags.name: cds-inline-button
tags.description:
Inline buttons are used inside and alongside textual content within Clarity components.
They give action buttons a less prominent, yet familiar, visual presence.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/button/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-inline-button>Button text goes here</cds-inline-button>
```

slots.description: Content slot for inside the button

tags.name: cds-icon

properties.name: shape
properties.description:
Changes the svg glyph displayed in the icon component. Defaults to the 'unknown' icon if
the specified icon cannot be found in the icon registry.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Apply numerical width-height or a t-shirt-sized CSS classname
properties.type: string | xs | sm | md | lg | xl | xxl

properties.name: direction
properties.description:
Takes a directional value that rotates the icon 90° with the
top of the icon pointing in the specified direction.

properties.name: flip
properties.description: Takes an orientation value that reverses the orientation of the icon vertically or horizontally'

properties.name: solid
properties.description: Displays most icons in their "filled" version if set to `true`.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Changes color of icon fills and outlines

properties.name: inverse
properties.description:
Inverts color of icon fills and outlines if `true`.
Useful for displaying icons on a dark background.

properties.name: badge
properties.description:
Sets the color of the icon decoration that appears in the top-right corner
of the glyph. The icon decoration is derived from the following predefined types.

The color of the badge can change according to the following
list of statuses:
'info'  -> blue dot
'success' -> green dot
'warning' -> yellow dot
'danger' -> red dot
'inherit' -> dot inherits color of full icon glyph
'warning-triangle' -> yellow triangle
'inherit-triangle' -> triangle inherits color of full icon glyph
unrecognized value, empty string, or true -> red dot

By default, the badge displays a 'danger' dot (a red-colored dot).

Setting the badge to 'false' or removing the attribute will remove the default icon badge.
properties.type: info | success | warning | danger | inherit | warning  -triangle | inherit-triangle

tags.name: cds-icon

the specified icon cannot be found in the icon registry.

properties.name: size

properties.name: direction
properties.description:
Takes a directional value that rotates the icon 90° with the
top of the icon pointing in the specified direction.

properties.name: flip
properties.description: Takes an orientation value that reverses the orientation of the icon vertically or horizontally'

properties.name: solid
properties.description: Displays most icons in their "filled" version if set to `true`.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Changes color of icon fills and outlines

properties.name: inverse
properties.description:
Inverts color of icon fills and outlines if `true`.
Useful for displaying icons on a dark background.

properties.name: badge
properties.description:
Sets the color of the icon decoration that appears in the top-right corner
of the glyph. The icon decoration is derived from the following predefined types.

The color of the badge can change according to the following
list of statuses:
'info'  -> blue dot
'success' -> green dot
'warning' -> yellow dot
'danger' -> red dot
'inherit' -> dot inherits color of full icon glyph
'warning-triangle' -> yellow triangle
'inherit-triangle' -> triangle inherits color of full icon glyph
unrecognized value, empty string, or true -> red dot

By default, the badge displays a 'danger' dot (a red-colored dot).

Setting the badge to 'false' or removing the attribute will remove the default icon badge.
properties.type: info | success | warning | danger | inherit | warning  -triangle | inherit-triangle

tags.name: cds-input-group
tags.description:
Input Group

```typescript
import '@cds/core/input/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-input-group>
   <label>Host URL</label>
   <cds-select cds-layout="align:shrink">
     <label>URL Protocol</label>
     <select>
       <option>https://</option>
       <option>http://</option>
     </select>
   </cds-select>
   <cds-input>
     <label>Host URL</label>
     <input placeholder="example.com" type="url" />
   </cds-input>
   <cds-control-message>Host ID: 123456</cds-control-message>
</cds-input-group>
```

slots.description: For projecting inputs

cssProperties.description: set as { x, y }. take care when customizing because overflow settings can have unintended side effects.

cssProperties.name: --max-height
cssProperties.description: sets hard limit on height of modal

cssProperties.name: --tablet-max-height
cssProperties.description: sets hard limit on height of modal when on a tablet in landscape mode

tags.name: cds-navigation
tags.description:
```typescript
import '@cds/core/navigation/register.js';
```

```html
  <cds-navigation>
    <cds-navigation-item><a href="/home">Home</cds-navigation-item>
    <cds-navigation-item><a href="/account">Account</cds-navigation-item>
  </cds-navigation>
```

properties.name: ariaActiveDescendant
properties.description: Set and update the aria-active descended value onto the navigation.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description:
Vertical navigation elements can be either wide or narrow. Expanded indicates it should be wide.
When navigation is wide cds-navigation-start button elements and cds-navigation-item a elements display
text. When it is narrow they do not (consumer should provide an icon that stays visible).

events.name: expandedChange
events.description: notify when the user has clicked the navigation expand/collapse button

tags.description:
```typescript
import '@cds/core/navigation/register.js';
```

```html
  <cds-navigation>
    <cds-navigation-item><a href="/home">Home</cds-navigation-item>
    <cds-navigation-item><a href="/account">Account</cds-navigation-item>
  </cds-navigation>
```

properties.name: ariaActiveDescendant
properties.description: Set and update the aria-active descended value onto the navigation.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description:
Vertical navigation elements can be either wide or narrow. Expanded indicates it should be wide.
When navigation is wide cds-navigation-start button elements and cds-navigation-item a elements display
text. When it is narrow they do not (consumer should provide an icon that stays visible).

events.name: expandedChange
events.description: notify when the user has clicked the navigation expand/collapse button

```html
<cds-password>
   <label>Password</label>
   <input type="password" />
   <cds-control-message>message text</cds-control-message>
</cds-password>
```

slots.description: For projecting password input and label

tags.name: cds-progress-circle
tags.description:
Circular progress indicators provide a method to track how close long-running tasks are to
completion. Circular progress offer a compact way to track progress in a variety of situations.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/progress-circle/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-progress-circle status="info" value="25"></cds-progress-circle>
```

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the color of the badge

properties.name: inverse
properties.description:
Inverts color of circular progress bar if `true`.
Useful for displaying icons on a dark background.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Represents the percent completed from 0 to 100.

If undefined, the progress-circle will be represented as an indeterminate
progress indicator – a.k.a a "spinner".

properties.name: line
properties.description:
Represents the thickness of the stroke of the circular progress.

If undefined, it defaults to 3.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Apply numerical width-height or a t-shirt-sized CSS classname
properties.type: string | sm | md | lg | xl | xxl

tags.name: cds-tag
tags.description:
Tags show concise metadata in a compact format.
Tags are visually styled to differentiate them from buttons.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/tag/register.js';
```

```html
<cds-tag status="info">Info</cds-tag>
```

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the color of the tag (and badge if present) from the following predefined list of statuses:

properties.name: color
properties.description: Sets the color of the tag (and badge if present) from a predefined list of choices

properties.name: closable
properties.description:
If present, shows a close icon to one side of the tag.
Note that applications must wire up the action to remove the tag on click and also
that you cannot have a clickable AND closable tag. The closable attribute-property
shows the close icon. What happens when the tag is clicked is for application developers
to decide.
If closable is present, the tag will be considered "clickable".

slots.description: Content slot for inside the tag

tags.name: cds-tag
tags.description:
Tags show concise metadata in a compact format.
Tags are visually styled to differentiate them from buttons.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/tag/register.js';
```

```html

```

properties.name: status
properties.description: Sets the color of the tag (and badge if present) from the following predefined list of statuses:

properties.name: color
properties.description: Sets the color of the tag (and badge if present) from a predefined list of choices

properties.name: closable
properties.description:
If present, shows a close icon to one side of the tag.
Note that applications must wire up the action to remove the tag on click and also
that you cannot have a clickable AND closable tag. The closable attribute-property
shows the close icon. What happens when the tag is clicked is for application developers
to decide.
If closable is present, the tag will be considered "clickable".

slots.description: Content slot for inside the tag

properties.name: open

tags.name: cds-tree
tags.description:
Tree view is a hierarchical component that gives users access to a hierarchical set of objects displayed in a the parent-child relationship.

```typescript
import '@cds/core/tree-view/register.js';
```

```html
  <cds-tree>
    <cds-tree-item>1</cds-tree-item>
    <cds-tree-item>2</cds-tree-item>
    <cds-tree-item>3</cds-tree-item>
  </cds-tree>
```

slots.description: Content slot for inside the tree

tags.name: cds-tree-item

```html
    <cds-tree-item>3</cds-tree-item>
  </cds-tree>
```

events.name: expandedChange
events.description: notify when the user has clicked the expand / collapse button

events.name: selectedChange
events.description: notify when the user has clicked the tree item
